website_summaries.verdict: A premium-level gaming tower that is designed with modular parts and quick swap outs in mind.
pros: Large interior offers plenty of room for different fan combinations and different part sizes
Separate sections detach from the inside, making part installation and swap outs much easier and quicker
cons: Case has been known to arrive with several bent interior parts like slot bays and mounting points

customer_reviews.title: Case is massive plenty of room to build excellent product especially for enthusiasts.
customer_reviews.text: This case is massive. If you want to liquid cool and have room to work inside of it, elbows and all, this is definitely the case to get. It is heavy so anticipate moving it with two people or mod it with wheels and wheel locks. Further the case is made out of solid metals and thick tinted tempered glass. This product isn't cheap but that has to be due to the material it cost to build. Another great bonus is it has 4 140mm RGB fans pre-installed. I had lost faith in TT, this case might have just renewed that.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: The case is great after I fixed the things they messed up
customer_reviews.text: Missing both the SSD cages it said it came with. Screws we jammed into some holes. And even then the clearly designed to slip in spots. Weren't slipped in. Had spots where three of four were in. And the forth was not. Therefore bending part of the cage. Missing one of the fans on top. Tried to contact Thermaltake by email and phone. Never received a reply or answer. The case is great after I fixed the things they messed up. With that said, with the support I received, which was none. I would recommend anyone not to buy from them. If you have a problem. No matter how minor. You will not get help for it.
customer_reviews.author: John Koetsier

customer_reviews.title: Incomplete Product Description
customer_reviews.text: When you display an item on the Amazon website as containing a certain piece of equipment, but then you intend to not include that equipment, it's important to actually say somewhere on the product description that the item DOES NOT include that equipment. So, for example, the water cooling equipment that comes separately at a cost of more than $500, should have been very explicitly stated as NOT being included. But instead all of the pictures and advertisements for this tower show it as if it's a part of the case.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Leep

customer_reviews.title: Do not use with non-thermaltake reservoirs and pumps unless you want a headache.
customer_reviews.text: This case was specifically engineered to only be compatible with Thermaltake's Pacific line of products. It was a real headache to get the EKWB Pump and Reservoir to fit in this computer (We had to actually drill holes into the case to give you an idea. Jimmy-rigging it didn't work at all.). Unless your pump and reservoir are Thermaltake, look elsewhere unless you want a ton of headache. Besides that? It's still a great case. It is one of the very few cases still on the market that natively allows quad radiators for watercooling. It allowed for insane overclocking performance on my brother's core i9 9900k, which runs hot as a furnace normally.
customer_reviews.author: Scot

customer_reviews.title: A beautiful fortress
customer_reviews.text: This is the very best PC case I've ever owned, seen, and worked with. It is built like a tank. The glass is thick but so clean and clear that you can't even tell that it's on there. Tons of space. You can vertically mount your gpu AND fill your other slots at the same time. I'll very likely have this case for a decade if not more. Expensive? Oh yeah it is but you'll know why once you open the box and especially when it's all together. The only con is that it is freakin HEAVY. I'll be removing all the glass and rigging something to wheel it outside to blow it out. I love this case!
customer_reviews.author: Walker

customer_reviews.title: Damaged in Shipping: Bent Parts
customer_reviews.text: Damaged in shipping. Drive bays were bent. A couple of minor manufacturing defects, which wouldn't detract from star rating. Damage to the drive bays resulted in one of them being unusable. Otherwise a very well designed case with more features than I've seen anywhere for such a low cost.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Mitchum

customer_reviews.title: One of the best purchases i have made this year so far
customer_reviews.text: One of the best purchases i have made this year so far. I went all out and bought the Thermaltake Pacific RL360 D5Water Cooling Kit x2 (be warned you will need to buy longer tubes). It has tons of room and is 100% modular which means if something wont fit just move things around, My Rig x2 x2 x2
customer_reviews.author: dco

customer_reviews.title: Cool idea at first but you'll quickly realize theres just too much wasted space
customer_reviews.text: I bought this with the intent of doing a super build and show off all the cool water loop parts. Upon starting the build I realized that 30% will just be hidden in the back like radiators , fans, some plumbing,etc. It kinds of defeats the purpose of buying this gigantic monster as a show piece. That said there is plenty of room to work with all your parts and add on whatever you want with out the worry for space. It's like working on those old cadillacs where there is enough room in the engine compartment for you to crawl in to vs today's modern cramped engine compartments.
customer_reviews.author: Bearfilm1

customer_reviews.title: ALL HAIL THE TOWER 900
customer_reviews.text: The biggest case on the market. I checked you can do water cooling, I guess but air is much better. You'll never run out of space and everyone will know that you are hard core with a case the size of a dorm refrigerator. Vertical motherboard mount, the backend has plenty space for cables and power supply. Big cage for hard drives and the front has a slot for a DVD drive. Looks great with RBG. You won't worry about anything fitting in this case ever. Amen
customer_reviews.author: Captain Motorcycle

customer_reviews.title: Roomy but limited
customer_reviews.text: This case is HUGE, I bought it because I wanted to build a computer with room, no clutter, and in which its components could breath. But so many cubic feet and so limited. It has slots for 8 drives, but I can’t transfer from my old computer a small internal multi card reader that I need, I had to buy an external one. If you need to install extra devices, everything has to be external.
customer_reviews.author: Jose Corral

customer_reviews.title: Amazing case
customer_reviews.text: came earlier than expected I was surprised at how big it was, but quickly realized its enormous potential for hard tube water cooling. I wish there was an option for pictures so I could show off its impressive build. I'm very pleased with my purchase and would highly recommend this case to anyone that is interested in a case made for custom water cooling.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The Godzilla of Computer cases !
customer_reviews.text: This is not for the faint of heart!, but upgrading my current system to a Dual Loop Acrylic monster ! Came in perfect condition, and after taking it fully apart, all components were as expected. Think of if it as a Mini Fridge, and you will be close to the size and weight of it ! since its 55lbs Just what I needed ;-)
customer_reviews.author: Liz S.

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Niche Case
customer_reviews.text: Obviously this thing is huge. If you’re looking for a case with plenty of room for a simple or complex liquid cooling setup and lets you see and / or show off your build, this is a great case for that. You can practically disassemble the entire case to make installing components and routing cables as easy as possible. Some past reviews noted low build quality and poor packaging leading to damages but I did not experience any issues like this. It is obviously a niche case but I love it.
customer_reviews.author: A. Birke

customer_reviews.title: My husband got this
customer_reviews.text: This is massive. My husband got this for a computer we are rebuilding. The prior case didn't have a side and was in rough shape. Functional but in need of upgrades. Moved everything over to the new case and it all works well, fits well with plenty of room for upgrades. Did I mention that it is massive. Absolutely massive but it is pretty cool.
customer_reviews.author: Leeane D.

customer_reviews.title: The best possible case you can buy for dual loop water cooling.
customer_reviews.text: The best possible case you can buy for dual loop water cooling. Case is VERY solid (heavy gauge steel), VERY large, and VERY modular. You can unscrew all of the parts from this case to reconfigure the inside. There is so much room for everything it gives you so much freedom for ideas. Make sure you have a badass desk that you can put this on because after putting everything in it mine weighs 80 pounds. You will also need power extensions for this case as the power supply goes on the bottom and the motherboard is on the top.
customer_reviews.author: Chase from San Antonio

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Size
customer_reviews.text: I have the TT Tower 900 and it is bigger than the 20HT. The 20HT size is perfect for me. The tower900 is too big and heavy too. Although the 20HT is a bit smaller, it is manageable when you need to upgrade, or tinker with your rig. The glass fans on top doesn't seem to hinder the temps. That was my first worry. Overall, I'd recommend this if you are coming from a Tower 900.
customer_reviews.author: Some Guy

customer_reviews.title: The ultimate case.
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the sweetest cases ive ever worked with. So much room, so many options. Excellent show piece for any PC enthusiast. highest quality parts at an excellent price. So easy to work with and so many ways to customize. Tempered glass baffels any noise that internal fans might make. The thing is about the size of a mini fridge. This is definately the choice if your hard piping water cooling for cpu and gpu.
customer_reviews.author: BudJohnson

customer_reviews.title: Best Case for dual water cooling
customer_reviews.text: It's an excellent case for water cooling for the money its unbeatable, I was going with the Corsair Obsidian D but its way over the limit i was willing to spend, nothing flimsy on this one, only used 2x 360 radiators but 540 wont be a problem either.Highly recommend, also went with the D5 pumps and all fittings. everything fit like a glove enough room for cable management, storage.
customer_reviews.author: Det

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic and Huge
customer_reviews.text: Great case, as I expected. Well built, attention to details, bolt patterns and motherboard plate perfectly fit. Tempered glass panels cut very well and easy to assemble. The unit is large and more than I expected, so I added castors in order to roll it around. Amazing display case for a water cooled rig. Mine is very simple, but you could really go just about anywhere with all the space in this case.
customer_reviews.author: F L A S H

customer_reviews.title: Godzilla the PC Case
customer_reviews.text: Let me first say this case is not for everyone. When I say this is big, think two mid towers stack side by side with two laying on top sideways and you still may not have the same size. This for me was a show piece that I could display and enjoy the looks, also the cable management is such a beauty, everything can be hidden away. Not to mention if I ever want to add it is quick and easy. One downfall is how easy it is to get finger prints on the glass.
customer_reviews.author: LostPoetB24

customer_reviews.title: Proprietary Pump Mounts
customer_reviews.text: If you have an EK pump then you need to drill into the case to mount it. Not cool at all. They don't even make an adapter that I have been able to find. I would not recommend the product. If it wasn't for the fact that I needed my PC up and working again I would have returned this case.
customer_reviews.author: Dill

customer_reviews.title: Amazing computer case
customer_reviews.text: Item is just as expected as like other reviews this computer case is HUGE!!! Only thing is from the measurement off the picture is a little off. The height of the case is around 24 inches, 19 inches wide and 20 inches deep. Can't wait to finish getting this all setup with my ideal liquid cooling. This case is so big and spacious, it's any computer gamer's dream as the possibility is limitless.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best PC case on the market IMO
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent case. It is large and therefore, easy to work within. The quality and workmanship is exceptional. Built like a tank. Easy to disassemble all or individual parts as or if required. I cannot think of anything about this case that I would change. Have built PC's using cases others but none compare to this one. Best bang for the buck.
customer_reviews.author: History Buff

customer_reviews.title: Great looking tower for build.
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful tower for impressive build. Can be air or liquid cooled. Build as air cooled - has two vent fans at the top that come with the tower. The needs additional fans for cooling. The area behind the motherboard stays cool with great ventilation. The front of the case runs a little warmer due to the glass enclosures, but never at levels greater than 50C on high loads. Plenty of space to hold HDD and SSDs - 4 front of the case and 4 back.
customer_reviews.author: Chad

customer_reviews.title: Great tower!
customer_reviews.text: I moved my current gaming computer into this one and added more fans for airflow including a Corsair Liquid CPU Cooler, including the cooler fans I have 13 140mm fans plus the three on the graphics card. Lots of room and airflow for all the components. I plan to expand eventually and perhaps add more liquid cooling. Having the Samsung 49" curved gaming monitor was heating things up a bit but now the increased airflow keeps the system at acceptable levels.
customer_reviews.author: OlGreenEyes

customer_reviews.title: Awesome PC Case!
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best cases that I have found in regards to the cost vs. what you can do with it! I am looking forward to slowly building a water cooled system however currently I moved the components from another PC since I wanted something I could keep personalizing. Due to the setup, there are so many things that you can do with it and it is easy to disassemble to get to everything.
customer_reviews.author: JAC

customer_reviews.title: I love it.
customer_reviews.text: Absolute monster. Only for ultimate builds with custom water loops and multiple large radiators and reservoirs. Complete over kill. Much larger than you think. Almost as tall as my desk and the size of an end table. Only for those that want to go completely overboard
customer_reviews.author: Puck

customer_reviews.title: One of the best case for a monster rig imaginable.
customer_reviews.text: This computer chassis is amazing. At first glance you can visibly see how large is the case. So large in fact that you need TWO people to lift it. It legitimately can hold almost every part imaginable. Please note that the case is meant for water cooling devices. But you CAN go with air cooling so long that you have proper fans to blow air in and out. Make sure you have enough space on any surface. Also make sure any table is strong enough to hold 60+ lbs.
customer_reviews.author: Cel

customer_reviews.title: Instructions Not Very Helpful
customer_reviews.text: The item was received pretty beat up with scratches and dented - which considering the cost - is pretty unfortunate. Screws were stripped out. Body lines don’t line up. No straight edges, lots of curves. I am assuming the shipping agent dropped the ball in that regard however maybe some improvement to the packaging could help protect the product better as well. The materials used to make the product seemed a bit cheap. The instruction book is essentially just a picture referencing a part with arrows - no real instruction regarding removing the top or assembly.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Cool case, bruh. Where are the screws?
customer_reviews.text: I received this tower as one of the first buys in a buy-over-time build. Purchased this item in September of 2018 and by late March, finally opened this heavy beast to throw it on my desk to start my build. After placing my CPU and CPU cooler on the motherboard, I noticed a glaring problem with my build: There are no screws. I cannot even put my motherboard onto the tower, let alone secure my power supply unit, solid state drive, and optical drive to my case. While I would love to give this tower a great review, the missing screws slightly sour my opinion of this buy.
customer_reviews.author: Gregg Strable

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this case... plenty of options for cable management, comes with magnetic fan filters that are easy to remove and clean, and the tempered glass is sexy!! Few minor gripes though... a few of the screws that hold on the tempered glass go in crooked, but thankfully when its put together you cant notice it... also if you're looking to use the included mounting plate for a water pump then you're stuck using Thermaltake pumps exclusively unless you remove the mount and start drilling your own holes. Other than that I genuinely have no gripes and as I said, I love the case!
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Farley

customer_reviews.title: although the cutouts on the bottom for water cooling pumps don't work well with anything other than the Thermaltake system this is easy to remedy with a short trip to Home Depot ...
customer_reviews.text: This case is massive, although the cutouts on the bottom for water cooling pumps don't work well with anything other than the Thermaltake system this is easy to remedy with a short trip to Home Depot and a new bracket and some rubber stoppers for vibration. be prepared to wonder what to do with all the space and look into extensions for motherboard cables.
customer_reviews.author: Skyline94

customer_reviews.title: Easy to modify, but its huge!!
customer_reviews.text: This case is HUGE! Its bigger than my... mini fridge. I decided to paint portions of the case and found the process to be fairly easy. Disassembly was quick and only requires a Phillips, directions were helpful and i was able to put it back together without much hassle. Lots of room for my water cooling setup with dual radiators and dual liquid cooled graphics cards. It should be pushing 75 lbs when its all together. May require team lift to move safety.
customer_reviews.author: J. Sella

customer_reviews.title: A keeper with some fitment issues.
customer_reviews.text: Overall a good case though I had a dead mesquite between the glass and protective film. I was also missing a grommet which TT took care of and received within a couple of days. I love the case itself, which some of the build quality was better, some holes and panels are not a perfect match and require a little muscle putting back together. All told, impressive case, and I plan on keeping it for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: PAPA.AMGTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: comes put together
customer_reviews.text: Mine came put together which is great!! i thought was going to have to assemble it myself. haven`t check it out completely other then taking it out of box to see if it was in good shape. i`m pleased to say that this is the first one i have ordered and it has no dents or and damage whatsoever that i can see. that's why it gets 5 stars from me. I`ll see once i install my parts how it rates.
customer_reviews.author: McElroy

customer_reviews.title: Showcaser's Dream!!!
customer_reviews.text: This case is a must have for anyone who wants to showcase their custom liquid cooling system. This case is so well built, that anyone wanting to buy a case that is gonna outlast the hardware that is inside it, then this is the case you need. The customization options for this are only limited to what you can dream up. Pros: Massive amount of room to build exactly what you want. Layout is perfect. So many options to go with. Top grade material. Cons: The only thing I could find wrong was a miss aligned hard drive cage. Nothing that can't be fixed. Not gonna take a star off for something so minor.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Hunt

customer_reviews.title: Mad scientist experiment
customer_reviews.text: Definitely the most fun I’ve ever had building a PC. Be prepared to spend a lot of money if you want it to look really cool. If you buy this a dual custom hardline loop is the only way to go. And if you’re gonna spend that much on a cooling system you might as well get the best parts money can buy. This case is ridiculously big and I love it! This is a showcase in which the design satiates the need for form to fit function. Not only is it beautiful, it’s modular design makes building even the most insane PC much much easier!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Mercer

customer_reviews.title: Good tower but be prepared
customer_reviews.text: I like this tower and was super excited to get it but I was less and less enthused when I unpacked it and there was already damage inside the case cosmetic damage but damage nonetheless. It was also missing motherboard screws.
customer_reviews.author: James Murr

customer_reviews.title: Large case. Easy to add items to the case.
customer_reviews.text: This case is large. After removing the three tempered glass panels it is very light and easy to work with. Adding fans was simple. I added three TT RGB fans, replaced the two existing at the top and added one to the 3.5" cage at the bottom. Moved the existing fans to the rear panel of the case. Note you will need extension cables for fans at these locations. I have G.SKILL RGB, motherboard RGB, and my video card has an RGB accents, they look great in this case.
customer_reviews.author: SCOTT

customer_reviews.title: Great Case
customer_reviews.text: The case arrived in perfect condition. I love the space inside this case! Everything about this case was very convenient and well thought-out. I just wish they had a part number for a cooling kit specific to the case and a standard mobo/video config.
customer_reviews.author: Max R

customer_reviews.title: The fans are Horrible lasted 2 days
customer_reviews.text: Great case but one of the fans failed in 2 days makes more noise then a crying baby for this price range why they would use cheap ceiling fans is ridiculous especially for this price range Of a case crazy maybe they will reach out to me for a Fan replacement.
customer_reviews.author: S&Kion

customer_reviews.title: No place for DVD
customer_reviews.text: I really like this PC case. The only problem I have with it is, there is no place for the DVD. It is good for if needed to get to different parts parts of the system to fix or upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: Taurus

customer_reviews.title: Pretty awesome case
customer_reviews.text: This is easily the biggest case I've ever purchased. It's literally the size of 2.5 ATX cases. Well-built, solid design with few flaws. Thermaltake needs to redesign some of the internal areas like the water cooling pump brackets up front. Adding some modular pieces for configuration swapping would have been amazing. All-in-all, I think this case may be the last one I ever buy. Absolutely fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: Rageous

customer_reviews.title: Why wouldn't you. Just buy it already.
customer_reviews.text: This case is MASSIVE. If you're not ready for a pedestal of glass awesomeness, I wouldn't recommend. However, if you've got the space, it's exactly what you want. Exactly. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: For the most part this is an amazing tower. Plenty of room for just about anything ...
customer_reviews.text: For the most part this is an amazing tower. Plenty of room for just about anything you want to put into it. Glass was a little darker than I expected but good and thick. CON- Only grip I had after buying this and the  which they show in the picture you cannot install a blueray drive anywhere other than the bottom of the case. I had to drill holes and mount to the inside of the case and that thing makes a really bad sound when running sideways.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Missing Parts
customer_reviews.text: Got the computer case, great looking unit. Several issues with it as well as AMAZON being no help missing the complete accessory package the screws, standoff bolts as well as the tools that come with it, cables and zip ties the whole 9 yards. Also missing one of the plastic grommets on the front glass panel and one of the screws that hold the rear pass through plate for the cables. First time having issues buying computer items off amazon. Will be my last tho to many site we’re the support team is welling to help!!!
customer_reviews.author: Cody

customer_reviews.title: Glass is lightly smoked so some additional case LED's add a nice finishing
customer_reviews.text: Well designed case with lots of room to build your latest dual loop water cooled system. Space for many fans (see description for size and number) but you may need some extension cables for your power supply leads as it is mounted on the bottom of the case so the ATX 12v cables may be tight depending on MB layout. Glass is lightly smoked so some additional case LED's add a nice finishing touch
customer_reviews.author: Off The Boil

customer_reviews.title: Monster case
customer_reviews.text: The size of a mini fridge. This is made for a water setup with pumps and pipes etc. So I had to mod it to be able take a AIO cooler. Also it needed wheels so I had to drill holes on the bottom and add them
customer_reviews.author: Chris Paul Persaud

customer_reviews.title: Monster Case Everyone Needs
customer_reviews.text: Exactly as you would expect, it is a beast of a case. Width of two standard mid towers and notably taller. Designed to have room for multiple water cooling tanks, radiators, GPU’s and drives. Expect to need longer cables/tubes based on where you install various parts. More nooks and slots for cable management than expected. Assume you won’t be moving it once you have it plugged in.
customer_reviews.author: Ian

customer_reviews.title: LARGE
customer_reviews.text: This is a very large case with many mounting options. Designed for duel loop configurations with most components hidden behind MOBO. Many configurations possible.
customer_reviews.author: Jerrod

customer_reviews.title: Bigger than my mini fridge
customer_reviews.text: This case is quite possibly the biggest case i have ever seen/used. It has more than enough room for almost anything you want to add. Most everything is removable which is to aid installation. The tempered glass panels are slightly tinted which makes it look very nice. I will update this review when I get my Ryzen system and all the cooling loop installed.
customer_reviews.author: Null86

customer_reviews.title: This tempered glass is really quality!
customer_reviews.text: This, I did for my personal office PC. The glass is really phenomenal. Thick, no smudging. Easy to put together. Had a hard bit getting the top off, but you just have to grab the back of the top a give it a bit of a pull. Love how clients come into the office and ask what it is. Hope to have an open loop running on this soon for eye candy.
customer_reviews.author: tmoody

customer_reviews.title: This case is a dream.... I ...
customer_reviews.text: This case is a dream.... I had to knock is down 2 stars because it arrived with one of the side panels shattered. and they way it is packed ... you are lucky it arrives without a smashed panel. I have seen the corsair glass case unboxed and they wrap and protect the glass panes separate. this case comes fully assembled with just Styrofoam protecting the glass.... big clean up
customer_reviews.author: LordPope

customer_reviews.title: Great case had some defects
customer_reviews.text: The Bad: small defects were noticed that I think might have occurred during shipping. Two screws had came lose and were floating around the case. One screw was for the latch on the right side and the washer for it was not to far from the screw well. The other screw that was for the drive racks was MIA. Finally a screw that held the front glass plate fits into a bent screw well and goes in at a angle. The Good The case is of great construction and I'm very happy with it. Nothing on this case feels cheep!
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCustomer

customer_reviews.title: Huge case - and built solid as hell!
customer_reviews.text: I needed a PC case that would allow for dual 460mm and this case delivered. Lots of space, lots of options, room for wiring and tons of options for mounting the SSD's as well as Sata Hard drives.
customer_reviews.author: Guy M.

customer_reviews.title: BEAST OF A CASE
customer_reviews.text: Looks can be deceiving. When i seen the pictures of the case i thought ok cool ima buy it. THEN.... i get it in the mail and to my surprise this BEAST OF A CASE is nearly the same size as my KITCHEN STOVE!!! heavy as hell but the quality of this case is probably the best ive seen in my life. I am absolutely blown away by this masterpiece.
customer_reviews.author: vincent sims

customer_reviews.title: Best Case.... EVER!
customer_reviews.text: This case is a beast! Easiest case to work in while building my new system. Just beware of its massive size. Measures 30" tall, by 19" wide, by 16" deep. The tempered glass is a bit darker than I thought it would be, which does make it a bit difficult to see the components inside unless you are in a very well lit room. All-in-all, I am VERY happy I purchased this case. Have already gotten many compliments on it from friends.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Burke

customer_reviews.title: DEFINITELY INSANE
customer_reviews.text: This is the greatest case ever... It is definitely INSANE for a custom built to really catch everyones attention. Very spacy and comfortable to work with. Lots of room to accommodate any type of motherboard, radiators, fans or peripherals. My wife says I bought a popcorn machine. Trust me I love it...
customer_reviews.author: M. Lozano

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Case
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome! A little bigger than I imagined but I didn’t look at the dimensions. It looks great, the layout is great and leaves plenty of room for expansion. It comes assembled and includes plenty of hardware, screws etc. for additional components. The only issue I’ve had so far is one fan that seems unbalanced, a little noisy but clears up with a little persuation. Highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: ChrisV

customer_reviews.title: Incompatible w/ All in One Cooling
customer_reviews.text: This was perhaps an oversight on my behalf. You're either air cooling or a custom loop. No in-between. Cannot fit an AIO cooler (H150i) without modding case. There's no way to mount the radiator in which the coolant tubes are long enough for the waterblock block to reach the CPU.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Best tower purchase I ever made.
customer_reviews.text: I love the Thermaltake Tower900. Its huge and spacious and its beautiful. I bought a second one for my dedicated stream PC. So much room and its modular design makes it very easy to add or change hardware. An awesome case for showing off your hardware and/or plumbing. I only wish the tower had more provisions for accessories like Fan hub controller, disc drive, etc.
customer_reviews.author: GERONIMO J FORBES

customer_reviews.title: Love this Case! 1000/5
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this case. There is so much room to do whatever you want with the amount of space in this. I kinda went a little overboard but well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Jarred

customer_reviews.title: Love it!!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love the case. The case makes the inside look like an exhibit. Only problem I had was I had to modify the case to put the water cooling in. Other than that absolutely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Cimorelli

customer_reviews.title: If you have a big build with lots of components this is the case you want
customer_reviews.text: The product was exactly as described. It was the best case for my build. Lots of room for cable management. Plenty of air flow. After 6 months I still have no complaints. Case arrived with a broken foot bad, and was immediately replaced by thermaltake with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Oister

customer_reviews.title: Awesome big case.
customer_reviews.text: Plenty of room for everything to run a dual reservoir setup. Perfect for showing off your rig.
customer_reviews.author: CB

customer_reviews.title: Big is beautiful!
customer_reviews.text: Case arrived in perfect condition. Lots of room to do a dual loop cooling system. Love how everything is easy dissemble. It includes to fans on the top of the case. One did not work and the other one was very noisy. Still giving the case 5 starts because it looks so great.
customer_reviews.author: M. Walters

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Very modular and easy to customize and take apart. Its also sterdy and easy to assemble. It is very heavy, but keep that in mind.
customer_reviews.author: Allain

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this case the only thing I don't like is you kinda have to RIP the top part off to get to lan/dp cables could have just done screws at the corners other than that so much space for anything you want to put In there it's amazing
customer_reviews.author: kris b.

customer_reviews.title: This is one amazing case. Very easy to work with for a ...
customer_reviews.text: This is one amazing case. Very easy to work with for a custom loop. Only issue I had is it's built for the TT pump/res combo, so if you're installing another mfg product then double check the measurements. I put a dual EKWB pump in this and ended up drilling out the case floor for mounting, but not a big deal.
customer_reviews.author: Zachary Smith

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product, just didn't work to well with my ...
customer_reviews.text: Amazing product, just didn't work to well with my closed loop liquid cooling! If anyone is doing a DIY liquid cooling system, id definitely recommend this Tower! Its sleak and amazing design quality!
customer_reviews.author: Smitty8421

customer_reviews.title: YUUUUUGGE!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is HUGE! Plenty of space for anything, including indoor racquetball! Easy to mess with. Very high build quality.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's big...and great
customer_reviews.text: This is a great case if you have the space. There's plenty of room, plenty of mounting options, makes me wanna get in there more often to add drives, upgrades, etc. Good value for the money. I did not go with a liquid cooled set-up ... works great for air-cooled set ups.
customer_reviews.author: Retibus

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: Worked out great for the parts I had. Was having a heat issue with my old case and I couldn't fit my new heat sink in my old case. Plenty of room in the new one!
customer_reviews.author: Leon J.

customer_reviews.title: Good case
customer_reviews.text: Biggest case ive seen its also nice i cant complain, its solid, the glass cover are thick and sturdy
customer_reviews.author: Rauldlc

customer_reviews.title: awesome case
customer_reviews.text: This thing is huge. Tons of room for custom Waterloo's and any hardware you want to fit in it. Its made to display your system and hardware. My favorite case I have owned so far.
customer_reviews.author: Dub

customer_reviews.title: One of a kind!
customer_reviews.text: This is made with so many incredible options as it's FULLY MODULAR. Biggest case I've ever seen for residential use!
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Paraczky

customer_reviews.title: Best case I've ever used
customer_reviews.text: In 20 years of building machines this maybe my favorite case of all time. It is huge and is so easy to work in. Not to mention it handles what ever hardware you want to install and configuration you are needing. It is also just visually stunning. Cant recommend enough!
customer_reviews.author: Garry Clark

customer_reviews.title: Easy to work with
customer_reviews.text: Massive monolithic design. Very handsome in the right lighting. Lots of space for watercooled builds, can fit 2 480 radiators which will be more than enough for water cooled GPUs. Easy to work with, mostly tool-less once built. Only issue is the acoustics are not great as the glass does not dampen fan noise at all.
customer_reviews.author: Derek

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE THIS CASE
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE THIS CASE! It is friggin' HUGE and HEAVY(even when empty) and looks awesome after I made some mod's to it(paint wise). It's air cooled atm and I will be doing 2 custom water loops in it soon.
customer_reviews.author: T E Cook

customer_reviews.title: Best Liquid Cooling Case for my latest Project
customer_reviews.text: Simply, if you have a liquid project in mind, this is your case.
customer_reviews.author: Ahn_Star

customer_reviews.title: Best case out there.
customer_reviews.text: Heavy duty and then some! Best case I have ever bought. Build quality is SOLID! Make sure you measure first. This thing is huge!
customer_reviews.author: Jeff A.

customer_reviews.title: The Tower 900
customer_reviews.text: Love the tower great platform to build on just a couple points its real heavy when empty like 27kg or 59.25 lbs and make sure you read the length of your power supply cords most are short so a set of ext wires are needed.
customer_reviews.author: tomcat

customer_reviews.title: not just for water cooling
customer_reviews.text: as seen in picture this is a great case to do test builds, its huge and fits many boards if not all mbs, i bought this case to make it my last case for my personal computer builds, i run a very nice fx 8350 aircooled on a micro atx board, love it while i plan upgrade builds for years to come in the same case
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Is basically a fridge
customer_reviews.text: So this thing is enormous like the picture dont do it justice and it weighs a friggen ton. That being said it's absolutely stunning when completed with a build inside of it and you cant really fine anything comparable with this kind of aesthetic. You do have to know what your doing a bit before diving into this beast but the upside is that it is easy to move around inside of it. I pretty much had my entire torso and head inside this case woth room to spare.
customer_reviews.author: alexander

customer_reviews.title: You need to buy it. Its not an option.
customer_reviews.text: Looks amazing great room and has a James Bond feel with the side panels. I'm so glad I purchased this to build my rig.
customer_reviews.author: Mike L.

customer_reviews.title: excellent build quality came in perfect no bent screws nothing ...
customer_reviews.text: excellent build quality came in perfect no bent screws nothing was missing glass is protected by plastic type wrap on inside and outside of glass sections plenty of room for rads,fans and hard drives, a ton of room for cable management I love it don't regret the purchase a bit. I love everything about this case I will post up pictures in 2-3 weeks when build is finished.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Space to maneuver!
customer_reviews.text: Can't beat the ease with which you can get in and out of this case. My favorite component in my build.
customer_reviews.author: Cormac Marnell

customer_reviews.title: ... it its larger than my mini fridge but its easy to customize considering you can take all of the ...
customer_reviews.text: it is a big case so make sure you have room for it its larger than my mini fridge but its easy to customize considering you can take all of the panels off
customer_reviews.author: freddie l.

customer_reviews.title: Good case, but product quality control appears bad.
customer_reviews.text: The case is exactly what I expected, but it has scuffs on it and doesn't look new. It was either previously used, or during assembly they hit it on things. Very sad.
customer_reviews.author: Cardale Goddard

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful case!
customer_reviews.text: This case is an absolute monster! It comes in just under 55 pounds and is the size of a small mini fridge. The build quality is top notch. I have become accustomed to every case having at least 1 flaw and so far I have not found one with this case. There is a huge amount of options for mounting your water cooling setup. I have not completed my build yet, I will update this review once I have.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Very well built and great alla round quality
customer_reviews.text: This case is HUGE! Very well built and great alla round quality. Directions for disassembly are terrible, but anyone with savvy will figure it out.
customer_reviews.author: D. Green

customer_reviews.title: Great big case
customer_reviews.text: This case is wonderful. Everything is completely modular making putting together your PC a breeze. Even when putting my old junky components in it looked good while I wait for my new ones. It's large enough to easily get your hands in where they need to be, no cramped spots. Just beware you might need some extender cables from your PSU if you're using something older because it places the PSU about as far away as it can get from the 8-pin CPU connector.
customer_reviews.author: Devin Abolins

customer_reviews.title: Big case for easy installs
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this case because I like big elaborate projects. the front is wide open for details and has a large back end section to hide away all the water cooling parts and fan controllers as needed.
customer_reviews.author: Bryon A.

customer_reviews.title: Love it, it has so much room and expand-ability
customer_reviews.text: Love it, it has so much room and expand-ability. I personally did some customization to the case to fit tubing routes mounted into some of the sheet metal in the case. The lack of bottom intake fan slots is actually kinda annoying, but there is something to note that there is plenty of vents at the bottom. So as long as your exhaust is adequate you should be good.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph M Williams

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love this case
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this case. The size of a refrigerator but damn it looks good when done right. Got all the room in the world for liquid cooling!
customer_reviews.author: lsaw5348

customer_reviews.title: Great Case be-careful with the Tempered Glass.
customer_reviews.text: I really like the case and there is so much room. However is there a way to purchase the side panel tempered glass as I shattered one. Con: Glass panels I think could be acrylic to prevent shattering.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: If size matters!
customer_reviews.text: Obviously this is for a specific consumer. It is bigger then it looks in photos. I'm currently building a custom pc and it's almost overwhelming how many options I have. Duel cooling loop..? . Duh!
customer_reviews.author: Tim A

customer_reviews.title: AS BIG AS A FISH TANK 😄
customer_reviews.text: This baby is HUGE as advertised, and worth the price if you want to build greatness, no excuses for extra room/ fit to ur build
customer_reviews.author: SIR BIGGZZ

customer_reviews.title: This case is out of this world lol
customer_reviews.text: I am a first time builder ..this case has made building a system for the first so easy ..the modular desighn is great .it gives you so many options .
customer_reviews.author: charles g.

customer_reviews.title: Enthusiast <3
customer_reviews.text: It's big and beautiful and worth the money if you're going all the way.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Grimm

product_meta.title: Thermaltake Tower 900 Black Edition Tempered Glass Fully Modular E-ATX Vertical Super Tower Computer Chassis CA-1H1-00F1WN-00
product_meta.description:
Size:E-ATX| Style:Tower 900| Color:BlackThermaltake the tower 900 CA-1H1-00F1WN-00 no power supply ATX full tower (Black), 6X 3.5" or 2.5" (HDD cage), 2X 2.5" (HDD tray).

It’s a great way for highlight components from all three sides……In our quest for unique cases we have come across some oddities, but the Tower900 seems to be both odd and actually pretty functional at the same time.” - Hardware Canucks

“The quality and craftsmanship of the Tower900 is excellent. The chassis is extremely well designed and expertly crafted. All the panels line up well, the paint is spot on and the fit and finish is very good. The color matching between the metal and plastic top panel is very good as well and the thick 5mm tempered glass panels have a very high quality look and feel to them.” -HardOCP


Designed in collaboration with Watermod France, The Tower 900 by Thermaltake represents Thermaltake’s passion for innovation, the spirit of Watemod France, and our vision to expand chassis design for enthusiasts to build into a new era of ESPORTS modding culture. The Tower 900 is the premium choice from TT Thermaltake supporting a vertical mounting design, high quality 5mm thick tempered glass panels, and unrivaled expansion capabilities for massive custom liquid cooling systems.


Model: The Tower 900
P/N: CA-1H1-00F1WN-00
Case Type: Full Tower
Dimension (H x W x D): 752 x 423 x 483 mm (29.6 x 16.7 x 19 inch)
Net Weight: 24.5 kg / 54 lb
Side Panel: Tempered Glass x 3 (5mm thickness)
Color Exterior & Interior : Black
Material: SGCC
Cooling System
Top (exhaust) : 140 x 140 x 25 mm Turbo fan (1000rpm, 16dBA) x 2
Drive Bays: -Accessible: 1 x 5.25’’ -Hidden: 6 x 3.5’’ or 2.5’’ (With HDD Cage) 2 x 2.5’’ (With HDD tray)
Expansion Slots:8
Motherboards: 6.7” x 6.7” (Mini ITX), 9.6” x 9.6” (Micro ATX), 
12” x 9.6” (ATX) , 12” x 13” (E-ATX)
I/O Port: USB 3.0 x 4, HD Audio x 1
PSU: Standard PS2 PSU (optional)

Fan Support 
Left Side: 4 x 120mm , 4 x 140mm 

Right Side: 4 x 120mm , 4 x 140mm
Top: 2 x 120mm , 2 x 140mm
Rear: 2 x 120mm , 2 x 140mm 
HDD Cage: 1 x 120mm , 1 x 140mm

Radiator Support 
Left / Right Side: 1 x 480mm , 1 x 560mm

Clearance 
CPU cooler height limitation: 260mm
VGA length limitation: 400mm
PSU length limitation: 220mm
feature_bullets: Supports Mini ITX, Micro VAX, ATX, E ATX Motherboard
Dimensions: 16.7" W x 19" D x 29.6" H | Net Weight: 54 lb
Designed for high end gaming system compatibility; I/O Port USB 3.0 x 4, HD Audio x 1
5 millimeter thick tempered glass window with Stunning Viewing. PSU : Standard PS2 PSU (optional)
Eliminates the issue with “GPU SAG”. Vertical mounting of multi GPU configurations on an E ATX platform
Dismantlable Modular Design: freely build the system from the ground up with given modular panels, racks, brackets, and pre design mounting arrays
Supporting dual loop liquid cooling systems
Tt LCS Certified: Liquid Cooling Supported. Compatible with extreme liquid cooling configurations

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars368 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
